pkgmetadata.longdescription: KONP Tests: Powerful K-Sample Tests for Right-Censored Data // The K-sample omnibus non-proportional hazards (KONP) tests are powerful non-parametric tests for comparing K (=2) hazard functions based on right-censored data (Gorfine, Schlesinger and Hsu, 2020, doi:10.1177/0962280220907355). These tests are consistent against any differences between the hazard functions of the groups. The KONP tests are often more powerful than other existing tests, especially under non-proportional hazard functions.
